images.alt: Photo of Joe's Pizza - New York, NY, United States

aboutTheBusiness.specialties: Established in 1975 by Joe Pozzuoli, originally of Naples, Italy - the birthplace of pizza, Joe's Pizza is a Greenwich Village institution offering the classic New York slice for over 48 years. A perennial top 10 listing in restaurant guides and publications, we serve the best slice in the city. New York Magazine names Joe's Pizza "Best of New York" and in subsequent reviews has referred to us as "the quintessential New York slice." In 2009, GQ Magazine listed us as one of the "Best 25 Pizzas on Earth." Throughout the years, our Greenwich Village location has become just as popular with tourists and visitors as it is with native New Yorkers who know where to come for an authentic New York street slice of pizza. After 40 years, we remain an independently owned and operated business, personally supervised by Joe himself. We are still what we've always been: a classic NY slice joint. No glossy corporate backing, no fancy pants pies, no pretensions nonsense, and no gimmicky budget pizza. We are tried and true; the real deal. Try us for the best NY slice around.
aboutTheBusiness.history:
in February 1975 Joe's Pizza opened for business and began earning its reputation as one of the best slices in town. Joe with the help of his sons, Andy and Dino, persevered manning the little, corner shop 7 days a week till the wee hours of the morning as the business began to grow.

Today, over 40 years after we served our first slice, we're just as popular as ever, located just about 50 feet from our original location, serving up the same great pizza. We look forward to adding you to our long list of happy, delighted customers!

reviews.text:
A classic pizza spot well known in NYC. We came here at the recommendation from a local we know and this place is on and poppin at all times!

You come in, greeted quick, order fast, pizza is moving and a shakin quickly! They only accept cash, so it's good that at least one person in our party had cash!

While I must say my slice was cold, but still good, the others in my group had a fresh out the oven slice, and it looked like they were in heaven, so I was of course, a little envious of their hot slice! Still a wonderful experience as we all got our slice, we ate outside, standing as we enjoyed the cool weather for the night.

--Location/Parking--
Located in the South Village right around the corner from the subway station. Easy to find, a lot of pedestrian traffic.

--Ambience--
Small, small with a line out the door and around the corner. The seating space can hold maybe like 8 people, and you see various other people eating their slice along the sidewalk. This is a to-go vibe where you grab your pizza and go. This is not a spot to hangout.

--Service/Staff--
The staff got me in and out where one was taking my order. Another staff member loading my slice of pizza the way I wanted and onto the pizza oven.

--Food/Products--
Thin and cheesy New York style pizza. You can't go wrong with this. I usually don't order plain cheese, but Joe's has got me hooked on a simple New York cheese slice pizza.

--Capacity--
Small New York pizza joint. Very common space for a New York establishment. There were lines out the door and around the corner from the pizza joint.

--Overall--
Love me some New York style pizza. I wish the line wasn't so long. The wait is not that long and you get your slice really fast.

When I was in New York, I just had to get an iconic NY slice. So, we decided to check out Joe's. We arrived at around 10am, right when it opened, but they hadn't prepared any slices yet. We came back around 2pm, and it was PACKED!

My friend and I each got a cheese pizza slice and a coke. Despite the crazy crowd, the staff was on top of things and served us right away. We took our slices outside to eat.

It was delicious and had that classic New York flavor. If you find yourself in NY, you absolutely have to give it a try.

CASH ONLY

I came here after traveling all day from California. It was late, and there weren't many places open. Joe's Pizza was within walking distance, so why not! 

There was no line when I was there. I remembered going during the day on my last visit 6 years ago, and there was a line out the door, but it went quick. 

I got a slice of pepperoni. Good size thin pizza. I started eating it on my walk back to the hotel, and finished it within a few blocks. They heated it so that warm cheesy pizza just hit the spot. I was still hungry after once slice, but that left room for me to try a couple other places that night.

This is a must go quick casual eat if you are in NYC, and in the area. If you have never been here, then it's definitely worth a try. Can't go wrong with good pizza.

Of all the NY pizzerias I visited, Joe's had the thinnest and crunchiest crusts! Fresh pizzas constantly came out scalding hot from the oven.

My slice of fresh mozz tasted simple and satisfying, but the hard crust cut the roof of my mouth. Fortunately, this wasn't a problem for any of our other pizza slices!

Its convenient location next to Times Square translated to heavy foot traffic. We waited in a long line of 30+ people, but aggressively efficient service got patrons in and out at a reasonable pace. You have the options of limited tight indoor seating or outdoor seating. 

If you like Spiderman or thin, crunchy pizzas, def drop by Joe's!

images.alt: Photo of Rubirosa - New York, NY, United States. Honey pie - sweet and spicy

aboutTheBusiness.specialties: Rubirosa specializes in old school American-Italian Cuisine.  Most noticeable is the Pappalardo family recipe for Rubirosa's thin crust pizza but also hosting an array of dishes. Starting off with traditional appetizers like Sicilian-style mini rice balls, roasted octopi or the famously acclaimed Beef Braciole; moving on to entrees that indulge the palate : Italian-American pasta dishes like Lasagna Napoletana, Chicken Parmesan or for the more adventurous the black and white Tagliatelle , all our pastas are house made. Don't forget to try our classic desserts that include the family recipe Cheesecake, our light and savory Tiramisu or the crispy Zeppole.
aboutTheBusiness.history:
Rubirosa was established in 2010 with a vision to bridge the gap between the old and new neighborhood regulars. As to date, Rubirosa's homey and comfortable atmosphere has accomplished to welcome every occasion, from family-style group dining to drinks and antipasti at our cozy bar. 
Inspiration for the creation of Rubirosa remounts to visits to Florence, Italy from Owner, Angelo Pappalardo to a restaurant of equal name. So, what is the origin of the name Rubirosa? Well, history associates none other than Porfirio Rubirosa (1909-1965), World-Wide diplomat, socialite and skillful playboy; Rubirosa lived a life that many would envy.

reviews.text:
They are fried to perfection. For our main lunch we had the infamous Tie Dye pie. 

The reservation window opens on resay a week before. Once inside the ambiance is cozy and intimate.

Great Food!

My friend and I were trying to go for the better part of two years end I finally made it there. We could not get a reservation so we got there about a half hour before it opened on a Sunday and they gave us a table with no issue.
Of course the top thing there is the tie-dyed pie but I also wanted to try the honey pie and I'm so happy I did because it turned out to be my favorite thing. We shared arugula salad, meatballs, pizza and baked clams. 
Service was attentive and polite. A must visit.

Had a really good meal here! Came with friends and we split a Caesar salad, vodka pasta, and tie dye pizza. The pizza was very good! Thin crust, nice flavors. The pasta was good as well. Not the strongest vodka flavor I've ever had, but I liked that. And the Caesar was good too. Classic caesar salad.
They brought bread for the table which was sooo fluffy and delicious.

It's a bit of a noisy atmosphere but great vibes inside.

Came back to Rubirosa with my parents for lunch on a Friday at 1:15pm. Even for lunch time, I suggest you try to get a reservation since this place is incredibly busy for a weekday lunch and all tables were full. We were seated promptly in the very back section of the restaurant (which I did not even know existed?) that is tucked away and a little bit more quiet than the entrance, which I appreciated. Service this time left me a little bit unimpressed which is why I'm giving it 4 stars. Our server felt a little dry and curt, less patient that prior times I've been here, and also forgot one of the items we ordered. Not sure if it's because we were in the very back but it made us feel like the service was less attentive than before. We split a few items on the menu which were delicious and made the trip worth it: 

Tie-Dye Pizza: now I understand why this is one of their most popular items. Even though I'm a pretty traditional gal with pizza, this pie was dreamy. First of all, the aesthetics are unmatched: the pizza is vibrantly colored at its base and then gets a perfect swirl of pesto right in front of you at the table. It also has an insanely thin crust that just looked perfectly crispy and elegant. The flavors were also really balanced. I loved the combination of having both tomato and vodka sauce since there was a nice sweet and tangy/more acidic contrast that was very nicely tied together by the creamy and salty mozzarella. The pesto was super subtle and was the perfect complement without being overpowering. The crust was sooo crispy and the slices were so thin! It was delicious... I will definitely be ordering this whenever I come back in the future. 

Lumanche Alla Vodka: my stepdad loves vodka pasta so we had to order this dish. Both my parents were blown away by this dish and really loved the sauce. I personally thought it was good but not any better than at other places in Little Italy. The pasta was not as Al dente as I would have liked and I felt like the sauce lacked some punch. However my family was very happy which is what mattered to me more since this is the dish they were most excited to have. They both said they liked this better than the pizza (possible pasta bias here). 

Tiramisu: their desserts have never disappointed and this was the best one I've tried on their menu so far! The slice of tiramisu is generous, the mascarpone blend is mildly sweet but not overpowering, perfectly creamy, and it's sandwiched between perfectly moist lady fingers that were not soggy at all. The flavor of the coffee was perfect! Loved this dessert and would order again in a heartbeat.

Overall, I had a good experience here! The food was still fantastic and if you are able to get a reservation the week before, I think it's well worth it. Prices are steeper than other places you can find in the city but the ingredients they use are very high quality and the ambiance is very nice-- it's also just a NYC classic that everyone should try at least once. Service was a little disappointing this time around but I've had good experiences before so it could have been just a random blip. I will definitely be coming back in the future for more delicious pizza!

We did not have a reservation but wanted to check Rubirosa out because we had heard great things. We arrived around 6:45 on a Sunday night and were told the wait for two was 2.5 hours. We decided to check out other bars in the area while we were waiting,and our wait only ended up being 1 hour! 

We got an arugula salad to start. It was very dark so hard to take pictures without either the flash or them turning up blurry. For pizza you can do split halves, so one side we did the tie dye which has a pesto drizzle. That was one was delicious, it's a great staple that I would encourage everyone to try! For the other half we got the san gennaro which had sausage. It was on the back of the menu and seemed like a special or limited time so we weee glad we could get it in the half potion. Service was very quick and the food came out fast. There is only one bathroom in the whole restaurant so that can take a while if there was a line. 

Rubirosa is definitely the place to go and if you can't get a reservation try your luck with a walk in!

name: Prince Street Pizza
amenitiesAndMore: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night

images.alt: Photo of Prince Street Pizza - New York, NY, United States. Our made to order Prince Street Pizza

reviews.text:
Prince street pizza was recommended to us by a personal shopper, and she did not lead us astray. I think everyone else's personal shopper in soho also is recommending Prince Street because the place was packed! Line out the door! Although they did move through it really quickly there were so many new people coming up I think they literally stay busy open to close. 

I was told the pepperoni was the pizza to get, my friend said it was amazing. I got the spicy vodka square and omg. I've have never had vodka sauce on pizza before, this was so so so good I can't even explain. The crust was ok, I prefer a thinner crust so I won't hold my personal preference against them.

Definitely has the reputation and lives up to the name. We came here a little after lunch and the line  was long but fast. Don't expect to eat comfortably as there's not a lot of seating,it's a  grab your pie and go type of establishment. 

We ordered a slice of  margarita and naughty pie (this was delicious) spicy and hint of honey and their vodka sauce and some drinks all for under $20 for 2 people is not to bad. Not sure it's the best pizza BUT it was amazing and will come back for sure. A place you have to try if you're in town for sure.

I'm a native New Yorker and can't believe it took me this long to try Prince St. Pizza. It was a Saturday afternoon, so the lines were super long. It is a very small place and the lines don't move that fast, so be prepared to wait. 

The service is honestly hit or miss. I can see how this job can be frustrating and tiring and it shows on the cashier guy's face. Good thing we ordered quick so we didn't give the guy a chance to be annoyed with us. 

We ordered the pepperoni and margarita. Both slices were thin crusted and extremely crispy. The pepperoni was slightly too oily but I guess pizza isn't supposed to be healthy? The margarita was good! We chased it down the with Mexican coke and it was a perfect snack.

I don't even have the words to say how disgusting this pizza looked and tasted that was ordered last night from prince street pizza. 

It was picked up and we ate it on the floor of the cupcake shop across the street - because there is no seating...but I mean look at it. Like what is this?! It was literally carried by us from the counter to where we ate it. The cheese was slapped on, barely...i can't even describe this. I mean honestly this pizza should be remade and replaced. I would hope that management reads this and does offer a new pizza.

I PM'ed the establishment on instagram and have received zero response back. The reviews and experiences here just keep getting worse and worse. This pizza is unexcusable. SMH

I used to be so excited to get pizza from here a few years ago...but now the staff is extremely unfriendly, they ignore you, they are not knowledgeable, the slices are either over cooked or semi raw, they never care to refill toppings, or clean the counters, the pizza isn't even as good as it used to be - not sure if the quality of ingredients changed. The music is always blasting in Spanish. I'm just over it.

I was soo excited to try this pizza. I've had it in Miami, and I know it's originally from New York so I thought it must be even better here. Oh was I wrong...so there's 2 different parts to order. The one  on the left is to order full pies and the one on the right is to order by the slice. When we got to ordering we requested the spicy vodka, the gentlemen stated there wasn't anymore. So we went with the spicy pepperoni and four cheese. Not even a second after I was done paying did they bring out the spicy vodka. It would've been nice if he would've said the next batch was in the oven and almost ready. Kind of disappointing 

The service was not great. The staff is rude and doesn't really acknowledge you. To make things more disappointing, the pizza was still cold. Maybe we came at a busy time which is why our experience was bad.

name: Joe's Pizza
amenitiesAndMore: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night

images.alt: Photo of Joe's Pizza - New York, NY, United States

aboutTheBusiness.specialties: Established in 1975 by Joe Pozzuoli, originally of Naples, Italy - the birthplace of pizza, Joe's Pizza is a Greenwich Village institution offering the classic New York slice for over 48 years. A perennial top 10 listing in restaurant guides and publications, we serve the best slice in the city. New York Magazine names Joe's Pizza "Best of New York" and in subsequent reviews has referred to us as "the quintessential New York slice." In 2009, GQ Magazine listed us as one of the "Best 25 Pizzas on Earth." Throughout the years, our Greenwich Village location has become just as popular with tourists and visitors as it is with native New Yorkers who know where to come for an authentic New York street slice of pizza. After 40 years, we remain an independently owned and operated business, personally supervised by Joe himself. We are still what we've always been: a classic NY slice joint. No glossy corporate backing, no fancy pants pies, no pretensions nonsense, and no gimmicky budget pizza. We are tried and true; the real deal. Try us for the best NY slice around.

reviews.text: Love the pepperoni pizzas here.. They give slices for takeaway as well. Staff is pretty friendly

Around 11, my friend and I made our way to Fulton St. near the Financial District. I was exhilarated because this would be my first experience of official New York pizza. My friend said, what better than to try your first time at the iconic Joe's Pizza?
 
There's not a lot of interior spacing, so be prepared to get quite cozy with your fellow diners. There's just a table or two with a few seats, otherwise, you can grab a stool or stand at one of countertops along the walls. Looking at the fully covered walls, I was pleasantly reminded that this place has made many a cameo in films and TV - such as Toby Maguire's Spiderman, Sex and the City, and Along Came Polly. Also, many celebrities and renown figures have also left their mark of approval here. I think my eyes were sparkling with childlike giddiness as I scanned through the glass displays. I let them know which pizzas and number of slices I wanted before heading to the register to pay. From the busy back and forth of the workers behind the counter to the nonstop chatter of orders being placed, the bustling sights and sounds of life tightly hugs you. 

Each slice is colossal! It's like a blanket of tantalizing yumminess that requires a two-hand hold. A pizza slice costs around $5, and it's well worth every penny! It's hard to precisely put down the flavor experience I had upon first bite, but I will say I fell immediately in love the moment I chomped down. There is something special about the thin pizza crust - a beautiful wisp of smokiness from the slightly charred spots, an almost tangy tinge like sourdough, and the perfect marriage of crunch and chewiness in terms of texture.

My two slices were spinach & cheese and the "supreme" style pizza (pepperoni, sausage, mushroom, onions). Both were amazing!

Joe's Pizza is known as the pizzeria from Spider-Man and seen all over Tik Tok. It was close by to my hotel, so I had to check it out late one night. It's conveniently open late and has several options for slice, but we ended up trying the pepperoni and fresh mozzarella. For $4-5, it's a good deal and sizeable slice. The crust was crisp, but I was hoping for more flavorful in the ingredients. Since pizza is made from only a couple things, I think it's critical to have really high quality ingredients. It's a decent slice and has several location locations around the city, but I think there are better options out there.

The restaurant itself was small. They had several counters for sitting and a few high tables to eat it fresh. After they reheated the slices on the deck oven, we walked a block to the hotel and ate them there. I don't know how much impacted the score, but a freshly made pie would have definitely been tastier (maybe going earlier in the day could lead to fresh pies). The service was very quick so be ready with what type of slice you want.

Food: 7.4/10
Location: 8.3/10
Service: 7.9/10
Environment: 7.1/10

food: 
50/50
service: 25/25
ambience: 25/25

Joes Pizza embodies the classic NYC cheese slice. 
Walk dont run to grab your slice of goodness :) 
service is standard nyc vibes meaning, if you dont know what u want move out the way so others can order lol 
Not many places to sit but they do have the ovd outdoor indoor seating :)

Joe's is always good for a quick slice. Several locations throughout the city and they all seem to have different reviews. But they all offer pizza by the slice along with full pies which I'm sure are even better bc it would be fresh from the oven. The crust is perfect NY - not too thin like a slice of paper but foldable as a slice should be and with those little black specks peppered throughout. Expect to wait in line depending on location and time of day but it moves quickly. Order at the counter and if you're lucky you may find a space to eat at a stand up table.

images.alt: Photo of Lombardi's Pizza - New York, NY, United States. Rustic Double Pepperoni

reviews.text:
Great food, quick service and wonderful ambience! We arrived on a Saturday afternoon and only waited about 15 minutes. 

The Meatball & Ricotta Red Pie is the shit. Generous amount of meatballs and giant globs of creamy ricotta served piping hot. God, it was so freakin' good. Pair it with a beer - it's the ultimate combo. 

The Bruschetta served on Rustic Bread was made with vine ripe tomatoes, balsamic vinegar, oil, onion, grated cheese with salts and peppers. One order comes with four pieces. I found it to be wonderful. It was fresh and the seasonings were plentiful. As with the pizza, each slice was generously prepared.

The prices are a little bit on the steeper end. But when you're America's First Pizzeria (?), you get to charge whatever you want. 

Cash only. Expect a wait.

I did not want to take my friends from out of town to Little Italy because of the obvious tourist trap quality of food and ridiculous prices, but they insisted and time was an issue. So rather than go to John's or Prince St for pizza we ended up in Lombardi's.
They do have the title of oldest pizzeria since 1905 and it's a coal fired oven. They do not make full sized pies anymore the only option is 12", basically for the same price.
We ordered 2, a pepperoni and a sausage and pepper. The pepperoni crust was black on the bottom. The other was cooked fine but the sauce on both seemed raw.
Do not go here unless there is no option or you want to check "oldest pizzeria" off your bucket list.

Pizza still good, but very light. There wasn't a wait when we came but after we left there was a long line. 

We shared 2 pizzas- the pepperoni one and a margherita pizza with half sausage on one side. We also shared a Caesar salad and a cheesecake. The Caesar salad was massive! Enough for 4 people. The pepperoni pizza was delicious. We each ate 4 slices but didn't feel full afterwards. Cheesecake was delicious too. 

Service was a bit lacking. Cash only!

This place was recommended by a few locals that my friends & I had to try & see what the fuss was about. Honestly, it was great but I wouldn't brag about it. The pepperoni was chefs kiss, a little bit of spice to it & cooked just right. Tried a white pizza & it was too cheesy. The fettuccine Alfredo was very buttery & light. Bad thing about this place is that they're a *Cash Only* restaurant. There was a wait to sit down & a long line for one bathroom.

Food was great.  
Service was very attentive.  
Ambiance is old school Italy feeling.  We arrived a little before 12 (opens at 12) and they let us seat so we didn't have to wait outside in the rain.  It got pretty packed. 

Did a stop at NYC as layover and was recommended this place for the margherita.  We ordered:
1. Classic iceberg salad - nice presentation with the steak knife.  A bit too much dressing for me but overall good. 
2. Clam pie - loaded clam, very good, recommended. 
3. Buddy's cake boss - I like arugula so no complaints on that but could add a bit more prosciutto 
4. Meatball ricotta garlic - I couldn't quite taste the basil but otherwise good combo 
5. Margherita, extra crispy crust- the mozzarella is very yummy.  

Of the 4 pies, my favs are the clam & margherita.  My first real NY pizza and although the crust was thin, I wished the sauce & toppings would cover the crust more with lesser ends.  

Our server was very attentive and the drinks came out fast.

name: Joe's Pizza
amenitiesAndMore: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night

images.alt: Photo of Joe's Pizza - New York, NY, United States

aboutTheBusiness.specialties: Established in 1975 by Joe Pozzuoli, originally of Naples, Italy - the birthplace of pizza, Joe's Pizza is a Greenwich Village institution offering the classic New York slice for over 48 years. A perennial top 10 listing in restaurant guides and publications, we serve the best slice in the city. New York Magazine names Joe's Pizza "Best of New York" and in subsequent reviews has referred to us as "the quintessential New York slice." In 2009, GQ Magazine listed us as one of the "Best 25 Pizzas on Earth." Throughout the years, our Greenwich Village location has become just as popular with tourists and visitors as it is with native New Yorkers who know where to come for an authentic New York street slice of pizza. After 40 years, we remain an independently owned and operated business, personally supervised by Joe himself. We are still what we've always been: a classic NY slice joint. No glossy corporate backing, no fancy pants pies, no pretensions nonsense, and no gimmicky budget pizza. We are tried and true; the real deal. Try us for the best NY slice around.
aboutTheBusiness.history: Since 1975, family run for three generations. Joe’s Pizza is widely considered the quintessential slice in New York City.

reviews.text:
Definitely a worthwhile experience when in New York! Pizzas were delicious, my favorite was definitely the Supreme and Caprese. The Caprese had delicious fresh tomatoes, and the Supreme was packed with toppings. Can't go wrong with either!

Personally, the white wasn't it for me. It felt pretty plain and lacked flavor. 

Expect a bit of a wait, since they do heat up the pizza before serving it to you. Probably took us about a 30 minute wait on a Sunday night at this particular location. There are some seats inside and some standing area outside to eat the pizza. 

Inside of the restaurant, it felt a little packed in my opinion, but it's probably because it's a popular destination. I would definitely come here again for the Supreme... but probably at a non-peak hour.

Joe's is well-rated, and for good reason. The small, efficient, and exceedingly busy pizza shop serves pizza straight out from the oven, should you order a whole pie, and the slices were so fresh I basically burned myself eating them. 

We got the Supreme on our first visit, and it was, aside from being utterly covered with meats, completely amazing. The burns were worth it, and I cannot recommend buying a whole pie enough.

Handsdown authentic New York pizza. Recently visited New York and this was a highly recommended place. I exceeded the expectations I had with their flavors. 

The Caprese with the fresh tomatoes and little burnt basil with that cheese; mind blowing and must try pizza. It was smelled good, tasted amazing. 

Fresh Mozzarella pie with that mozzarella on top, yummy!!!

The pizza dough itself was so flavorful and right crisp to it. Overall amazing experience. 

Service:
There was a big line in front of their restaurant and did all make sense once I took that first bite and they were quickly serving and clearing the line. 

Loved that they had option to add chili flakes, oregano and cheese to add on top according to you flavor. 

Must try place!! Can't skip. Just a recommendation if you are looking for a place to sit and enjoy, maybe pickup is the best option as the restaurant is usually fully packed.

Joes pizza was all its hype said it was. Great my style pizza, with the lines to validate that. Must have waited 30 minutes but was worth every bite. Thin crusted pizza that does not sag in center slice point. Pretty amazing gravity defying pizza. Perfect balance of sauce, cheese to crust, makes joes the gold stands
Rd in NY style pizza.

--Location/Parking--
It's New York, what parking?

--Ambience--
New York pizza joint with a line out the door and crowds of people trying to eat in a small area. It is typical to see people eating a slide out on the sidewalks.

--Service/Staff--
The staff is fast and direct, getting you in and out as quickly as possible.

--Food/Products--
New York style pizza was piping hot. I think I burned my mouth, but the new York style is my favorite, and I can't complain.

--Capacity--
Very small, you see people lounging around eating on the sidewalk or outside or taking it to go.

--Overall--
One of the popular tourist spots in New York. If you ask a local about their favorite pizza spots, you will get various answers.
